body: @wallacepang can you provide the stack trace?
Hi, please check your path, from the stack trace you provided, there is nothing to do on Dubbo side. I am closing it now.
An interesting issue ðŸ‘
@lovepoem Do we have anything to do with this issue?

>The native Map from jdk is ok
But com.google.common.collect.SingletonImmutableMap is from guavaï¼Œ the map initialize method is differentã€‚

>Do we have anything to do with this issue?


Noï¼Œit's not very easy to support the  special Map from guava, I suggest to use Map from jdk in the business interface
ok, I am closing it now.
It seems  @service of dubbo should register bean to spring context to avoid this case.
It seems  @service of dubbo should register bean to spring context to avoid this case.
@ralf0131 Sorry, I understand your reply incompletely. Do you mean that I should not add a "threadpool" tag to any complex tag? Instead I should solve this problem by other methods?

you can use dubbo-admin to enable or disable service. refer #28. 
or you can modify registery information adding `disabled=true`
I know the reason for this: One of your business interface has two methods with the same names.

it is not a problem.
Setter method should be void. If not, it will throw NoSuchPropertyException like u see. 
By the way, org.apache.dubbo.common.json.JSON is Deprecated.  :)

NEED-CLOSE

@ralf0131

The loadbalance in provider will overwrite in consumer if loadbalacne don't config in consumer. :)
For ex:
consumer side : <dubbo:reference .../>
provider side : <dubbo:service loadbalance="leastactive" .../>
Then, consumer will use LeastActiveLoadBalance to select invoker.

NEED-CLOSE

@ralf0131
@tswstarplanet Maybe I misunderstood your meaning, I thought you were going to add a label called 'theadpool' :) So what do you actually mean?
I think Dubbo does not support this feature right now. Feel free to contribute.
I am not quite understand what your problem is, would you please elaborate moreï¼Ÿ

Hi, the latest Dubbo has supported REST, which is based on resteasy.

Please check the latest code.

I am closing this issue now, please feel free to reopen it if it still exists.
Hi, this issue has been fixed in the latest code.
Hi, from you description, there is nothing to do on Dubbo side.
Please check this: http://dubbo.apache.org/#!/docs/user/demos/explicit-target.md
This issue has been fixed from 2.7.x onwards.

Maybe due to JIT compilation. The system is not warmed up yet. 

It is hard to identify without more details.

I am closing it for now. If you still encounter this issue, please provide more details and reopen this issue.

@ralf0131 Yes, I think adding a label "threadpool" can solve the problem. But maybe my English is a little poor, I don't understand your reply published this morning. I'm not sure you say yes or no to my plan.
@multiplyzero 's suggestion should work.

This is because you've compile your source on Java 8 with target 1.7 and run it on a JVM that is lower than Java 8.

If you are running a Java 7, please compile the source code with Java 7.

Check this: https://gist.github.com/AlainODea/1375759b8720a3f9f094

Hi, please check this blog: http://dubbo.apache.org/#!/blog/pinpoint.md?

I agree with @panhongliang . You can not force a thread to exit. Dubbo has done as much as it can to stop the threads. For those thread who do not respond to InterruptedException, there is no way to stop  them.
Please check this doc: http://dubbo.apache.org/#!/docs/user/demos/graceful-shutdown.md

Hi, can you provide to reproduce your issue?

Stub can only be used in consumer side: http://dubbo.apache.org/#!/docs/user/demos/local-stub.md?lang=zh-cn

Hi, if you new provider comes online, the address will be pushed to consumer, the consumer will do the load balance according to your load balance strategy. If the consumer decide to choose the new provider, it will establish connection to the new provider. 

Load balance will be done each time, but connection establishment will only be done once.

@ralf0131 
NEED-CLOSE

AllChannelHandler is designed to dispatch.
Dispatch the msg to business thread to increase provider system throughput. It can also deal some event like connected and disconnected.

The ExecutionChannelHandler will only dispatch request msg.
Other messages like response, connect, disconnect will be directly executed by I/O thread.

NEED-CLOSE
